thread.title: Holly Willoughby is the new face of Diet Coke, following in Taylor Swift's footsteps

author: mirror.co.uk
title: Holly Willoughby is the new face of Diet Coke, following in Taylor Swift's footsteps

organizations.name: facebook follow us on twitter celebs newsletter follow @mirrorceleb subscribe

text:
Holly Willoughby is the new face of Diet Coke, following in Taylor Swift's footsteps The TV favourite adds yet ANOTHER job to her already packed schedule Share Comments By Mirror .co.uk Lara Martin 22:24, 15 FEB 2017 Celebs Holly Willoughby for Diet Coke (Photo: Imagewise Ltd/REX/Shutterstock) Share Comments Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email Holly Willoughby has added yet ANOTHER string to her already packed bow, after being snapped up as the new face of Diet Coke.
The 36-year-old presenter of ITV’s This Morning is following in the footsteps of superstar Taylor Swift by announcing her exciting partnership with the soft drinks giant on Wednesday.
“I’ve always been a big Diet Coke fan, right from the original ‘Break’ ads we all remember with great fondness. The brand is well known for celebrating friendship, fashion and fun, which are all very important to me. I’m excited to be involved!” said Holly.
Holly said she's "excited" by the new role (Photo: Imagewise Ltd/REX/Shutterstock) Holly will front the brand's 2017 campaign (Photo: Imagewise Ltd/REX/Shutterstock) She praised the brand's focus on fun and friendship (Photo: Imagewise Ltd/REX/Shutterstock) Read More Holly Willoughby and Phillip Schofield to be replaced on This Morning during half-term Previous Diet Coke ambassadors have included country superstar Taylor Swift and Coleen Rooney, who fronted a campaign for the company before her marriage to footballer Wayne Rooney.
It’s just the latest job for busy Holly who already juggles her packed TV career with several endorsement deals and life as a mum to three young children.
As well as her daily job alongside Phillip Schofield on This Morning, she’s a Team Captain on Celebrity Juice, presents the rebooted Surprise Surprise, and fronts Play To The Whistle and Meet The Parents.
Holly fronts This Morning with Phillip Schofield (Photo: Getty) She's also on Celebrity Juice with Keith Lemon and Fearne Cotton (Photo: ITV) Read More Holly Willoughby celebrates 36th birthday in the BEST way - with her adorable three children Off screen, the busy star been a brand ambassador for the likes of Oral-B and Garnier, written a string of children’s books with sister Kelly, and promotes several charities.
It was reported earlier this month that Holly could soon be worth £21million after launching a new interior design business with Dragons' Den star Peter Jones.
The This Morning star already boasts a £11million fortune and the lucrative venture will reportedly see her double her worth, making her one of the highest paid female TV presenters in the UK.
Holly and Peter's partner Tara Capp - who have been good friends for years - have set up Truly Group Ltd.
Read More Holly Willoughby and Phillip Schofield left in hysterics struggling to record promo about Gwyneth Paltrow's 'tidy pantry' Holly Willoughby (Photo: Rex Features) It's said she is planning to unveil the plans later this year.
In 2015, Holly made £650,000 as a co-host of This Morning and The Voice and also made a tidy sum from various endorsement deals, clothing ranges and children's books.
She currently earns £400,000 a year for presenting This Morning.
Peter Jones (Photo: BBC) A brand expert told the Daily Mail that said the move could net her at least £10million.
While PR expert Neil Mcleod added: "Her name is very much already a brand on its own – she is trusted, she has style, she is smart and likeable.
Holly's pin curl waves (Photo: Rex) (Photo: Rex Features) "On top of this, she is real. Consumers are buying into a lifestyle when they buy products associated with her. That is a big draw.
"Holly’s new venture with such a notable business tycoon has the potential to make her millions and many celebrities go on to be hugely successful designers, utilising their name and public profile to boost interest and ultimately sales."
While celebrity interior designer Dawn Ward told Bella magazine: “She's one of the nation's best-loved TV presenters and has a name people instantly trust and recognise.
“It will also help that she has some great celebrity friends who she can get on board to promote her work.”
